alert.note: Alert for Harper; Harvey; Kingman; Reno; Sedgwick; Sumner (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 30 at 1:43AM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Reno, western Sedgwick, western Harvey, Harper, eastern Kingman and western Sumner Counties through 215 AM CDT... At 143 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 8 miles east of Kingman to near Anthony to Great Salt Plains Lake. Movement was northeast at 80 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Wichita, Goddard, Hesston, Maize, Kingman, Clearwater, Anthony, Cheney, Halstead, Harper, Colwich, Conway Springs, Haven, Caldwell, Burrton, Garden Plain, Mount Hope, Pretty Prairie, Andale and Bentley. This includes Interstate 135 near Mile Marker 42. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Harper; Harvey; Kingman; Reno; Sedgwick; Sumner
